|Title=Knowing the investigations to be carried out in the event of an upper genital infection in women
|Description=None
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=
|Order=17}}
- Upper genital infection in women :

         - CRP, CBC,

         - Sampling with speculum for direct examination + standard culture + PCR ''Neisseria gonorrhoeae'' and ''Chlamydia trachomatis'',

         - Surgical or radioguided specimen if complicated infection for culture + PCR for Neisseria gonorrhoeae and Chlamydia trachomatis, + search for mycoplasma.

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a recommended investigation for an upper genital infection in women?
properties.option_b: Speculum examination with direct culture and PCR for Neisseria gonorrhoeae and Chlamydia trachomatis
properties.option_c: Radioguided specimen collection if the infection is complicated
properties.option_d: Ultrasound imaging of the lower abdomen
